title: head
comment: The position of the head often expresses an attitude or emotion. Figuratively head may mean ``chief'', ``first'' or ``top''.

cschildren.title: The head as part of the body
The head as the uppermost part of the body

children.title: A crown worn on the head
A turban worn on the head

cschildren.title: Head used figuratively in various expressions

children.title: ``Be it on one's own head'': personal responsibility that is inescapable
``To come back on one's own head'': a wrongdoer suffering the very wrong he or she has committed
``To heap burning coals on his head'': generosity towards an enemy in the hope of causing a change of heart
``Not a hair on one's head will be lost'': absolute safety
``Making it up out of one's head'': imagining something

cschildren.title: Covering or uncovering the head in Christian worship

Various attitudes expressed with the head

children.title: Lifting up the head in joy and expectation
Hanging the head in shame and dejection
The head of a family, tribe or kingdom
